column4: I have just answered my own question: "No /boot/grub/menu.lst. It has been replaced by /boot/grub/grub.cfg. "
you dont edit that file though. Here's a good Grub Tutorial: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1195275

that's one of the things that I am finding most difficult in this transition to Linux: most often (in programs in general, display settings, fonts, etc.) there are several files in the system that configure the same thing, and I don't know which of them has the highest priority
add a bit of pizazz :-) to Grub2 menu also: http://blogs.koolwal.net/2008/12/16/how-to-grub2-and-grub-pc-installing-splash-images/
